titlestmt.titleproper: Wagner Free Institute of Science director's files regarding rental properties 1885-1888
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science director's files regarding rental properties

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865. Since 1891, the specimen collections have been displayed according to Darwinian principles of evolution, the organizational scheme selected by renowned biologist Joseph Leidy during his tenure as head of the Institute's scientific and educational programs in the late 19th century.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of rental properties owned by the Wagner Free Institute of Science, dating from 1885 through 1888. These documents include bills, receipts for maintenance work, tenant complaints, and agent reports on the rental properties. There is one folder of correspondence addressed to William Wagner or the Trustees of the Institute, on the Agassiz Association, proposed lecture topics, employment, and other matters.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: other collections that include significant amounts of director's records include: director's files and business records (90-010), Actuary and Librarian records (91-040), director's reports (98-045 and 00-01), and other director's files (90-001 and 89-055, 91-035, 93-005, 99-109, and 00-02).
